===Etymology===
Probably related to verb {{m|ja|千早ぶ|tr=chihayabu||to move or act ferociously, with terrible godly power}}, itself an alteration from {{m|ja|逸早ぶ|tr=ichihayabu||to move or act quickly and strongly}}, deriving from adjective {{m|ja|逸早し|tr=ichihayashi||strong and fast; extremely fast}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{l|ja|sc=Latn|訓読み|Kun'yomi}}
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[t͡ɕiha̠ja̠]}}

===Alternative forms===
* {{ja-l|千早}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ちはや}}

# a [[cloth]] or [[cord]] used to tie back the [[sleeve]]s of a [[robe]], primarily used by women to get the sleeves out of the way for work such as shrine ceremonies or kitchen work
# a kind of [[ceremonial]] [[overcoat]] with a long white [[hem]] worn by the sweeper or branch-holder in certain [[Shintō]] ceremonies
# a kind of sleeveless [[vest]] or [[waistcoat]] used in [[kabuki]] or {{m|ja|人形浄瑠璃|tr=ningyō jōruri||puppet theater}}
